data.title: This Perfect Day by Ira Levin, First Edition
data.meta_description: This Perfect Day by Ira Levin and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Hardcover. Condition: Good. First Edition. The time of the novel is a century and a half after the unification of the nation, and its hero is a young may called Chip who fights a desperate battle for freedom in a world benumbed by chemistry and computerization.

hardcover. Condition: Good. First Edition. First printing, stated on the copyright page. Book has shelf wear. Staining has occurred on the half title page and title page.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good. First Edition. Name of the previous owner. Fist UK edition, 1970. The dust jacket is a little shelf rubbed and edge worn. The boards are in good condition. Internally the pages are immaculately clean and complete. Tightly bound and presented beautifully in cellophane. The binding is excellent. GK. Our orders are shipped using tracked courier delivery services.

hardcover with dust jacket. Condition: fair. Dust Jacket Condition: good. 1st edition. Fair condition. Moderate to heavy wear. Binding is starting to loosen, pages age toned. Ex-Library book with usual stamps and labels.Dustjacket is in good condition with moderate wear, small tears and light chips present.Pictures available upon request. nd.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. Taupe colored cloth on boards with bright blue lettering to spine. Book is tight, square, sharp-cornered and free of markings or flaws inside and out. Top edge blue green. Unclipped Dust Jacket has full b/w author photo on back, small closed tear to bottom of spine - no scuffing or shelfwear. States Book Club Edition on inside of flap.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. A novel. Stated first printing. Very good in a very good dust jacket. Dust jacket design by Paul Bacon.

Hardcover. First printing. 22 x 14.5 cm. Octavo. 309pp. Blue and grey cloth in dust jacket. Stated first printing. Original price of $6.95 present on front flap. Bit of chipping and fading to the jacket. Very Good in Very Good dust jacket.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good. 1st Edition. Gifted copy, names on frontispiece. Dust jacket has one large tear on back, a small tear on top of front. Otherwise the book is tight, clean, unmarked with expected shelf wear for its age.

8vo. [6], 309, [1] pp. Double-page title. Half-cream coloured cloth over blue boards, copper metallic lettering (slight shelfwear), w/ d.j. cover art by Paul Bacon (1 very small closed tear, slight age toning), NF/VG copy, w/ former ownership markings on front pastedown. First edition, stated, of this dystopian science fiction of an artificial intelligence AI computer directing a supposedly perfect utopian society.

Half-Cloth. Condition: Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good. First Printing. This book has been bound with a cream spine, blue boards and copper gilt lettering. There is some edge wear, darkening and the upper corners of the boards have been bumped. Binding tight, text yellowed, unmarked, no cocking. Upper edge of text block colored light brown. DJ has edge darkening and wear. Flap hinges darkened, no chipping, unclipped. Size: 8vo - over 7¾" - 9¾" tall.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good +. First Edition/First Printing. A square tight solid clean un-read copy. The plain paper 6.95 jacket has some light rubbing, some edge wear, some soil and some browning to extremities and spine area. Over-all as nice a copy of this title that i have seen in a long time. A hard to find book. THIS COPY IS IN MY POSSESSION AND NORMALLY SHIPS NEXT DAY. Book.
